Class ControlAndCollectionSiteProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.ControlAndCollectionSiteProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMasterThief, IOrdinaryThief

    public class ControlAndCollectionSiteProxy
extends Object
implements IMasterThief, IOrdinaryThief
    Control And Collection Site Proxy to make requests to the Control And Collection Site Server.
    Author:
    Tiago Henriques nmec: 73046; Miguel Oliveira nmec: 72638

    • Method Detail

      • appraiseSit

        public int appraiseSit()
        In the Master Thief life cycle, transition between "deciding what to do" and "deciding what to do". The MasterThief decides what to do. If all rooms are empty and all parties are not deployed then the next state will be presenting the report. If there are enough thieves waiting to assemble a party and if the MasterThief has chosen which room to steal and which party to deploy then the next state will be assembling a group. If not, he has to wait for the assault parties to return if there are not enough waiting thieves to assemble a assault party or if there are still deployed assault parties, so the next state will be waiting for group arrival.
        Specified by:
        appraiseSit in interface IMasterThief
        Returns:
        the next state

      • takeARest

        public void takeARest()
        In Master Thief life cycle, transition between "deciding what to do" and "waiting for group arrival". CollectCanvas by Master Thief if any ordinary thief has arrived.
        Specified by:
        takeARest in interface IMasterThief

      • collectCanvas

        public void collectCanvas()
        In Master Thief life cycle, transition between "waiting for group arrival" and "deciding what to do". Decrease the number of canvas to collect.
        Specified by:
        collectCanvas in interface IMasterThief

      • handACanvas

        public void handACanvas(boolean hasCanvas,
                        int roomId,
                        int partyId,
                        int thiefId)
        In Ordinary Thief life cycle, transition between "outside" and "outside" While Master Thief is resting, the Ordinary Thief that has arrived has to wait until he wakes up. When he does, reset that party. If that ordinary thief returns with a canvas, the number of collected canvas is increased by the Master Thief and that room is set to rob again because there are still paintings left on that room to retrieve. If the ordinary thief doesn't return a canvas it means that the room is now empty and the room is set to empty.
        Specified by:
        handACanvas in interface IOrdinaryThief
        Parameters:
        hasCanvas - - True if thief has canvas; False otherwise
        roomId - - Room Identifier
        partyId - - Assault Party Identifier
        thiefId - - Thief Identifier
